page.title: 14STIBBINGTON'S TROUT FARM
page.content: The Trout Farm was set up 10 years ago. The trout first came from the Lincolnshire fisheries,and now the farm gets 1,000 per year. They are not sold but are bred to be fished for in a 3 acre gravel pit. The farm never has more than 2,000 fish in total,at one time, costing about Â£133 a month in food. The present manager has worked with fish for 22 years; his job now sometimes involves working from 4.30 in the morning to 10 o'clock at night. Although the farm is well protected there is a constant problem with pike and herons which eat the trout if not prevented. At present,the tickets for fishing in the trout lake cost Â£15 for a full day,Â£8 for a half day.
